last_episode_to_air.name: Is This Fort Really Necessary?
last_episode_to_air.overview: An efficiency expert comes to Fort Courage, with the authority to close it down.

name: F Troop
overview: F Troop is a satirical American television sitcom that originally aired for two seasons on ABC-TV. It debuted in the United States on September 14, 1965 and concluded its run on April 6, 1967 with a total of 65 episodes. The first season of 34 episodes was filmed in black-and-white, but the show switched to color for its second season.

episodes.name: Scourge of the West
episodes.overview: Private Wilton Parmenter gets promoted after leading a charge against the Confederates and receives an assignment as Fort Courage's new commanding officer.

episodes.name: Don't Look Now, One of Our Cannon Is Missing
episodes.overview: O'Rourke plots to retrieve the cannon he loaned to the Hekawis for use in a festival.

episodes.name: The Phantom Major
episodes.overview: A British Major shows the men the advantages of using camouflage to fight Indians.

episodes.name: Corporal Agarn's Farewell to the Troops
episodes.overview: Agarn believes he is dying after his medical report is mixed up with that of his horse.

episodes.name: The Return of Bald Eagle
episodes.overview: A renegade Indian tries to go straight but finds he can't.

episodes.name: Dirge for the Scourge
episodes.overview: Sam Urp, scourge of the west, comes to Fort Courage for a showdown with Parmenter, the Scourge of the West.

episodes.name: The Girl From Philadelphia
episodes.overview: Wilton's old girlfriend comes to vie for his affection and to persuade him to return to the East.

episodes.name: Old Iron Pants
episodes.overview: O'Rourke Enterprise's tries mail order brides while Parmenter is away at command school.

episodes.name: Me Heap Big Injun
episodes.overview: Agarn leaves the troop to become an Indian, and turns out to be a better Indian than the entire Hekawi tribe.

episodes.name: She's Only a Build in a Girdled Cage
episodes.overview: Dobbs' mother is coming but everyone thinks it is Laura Lee, a dance hall singer to entertain the men.

episodes.name: A Gift From the Chief
episodes.overview: Parmenter accidentally saves Wild Eagle's life, and receives a baby as a reward.

episodes.name: Honest Injun
episodes.overview: A con man muscles his way into O'Rourke Enterprises by selling worthless land as potential gold mines.

episodes.name: O'Rourke vs. O'Reilly
episodes.overview: A beautiful woman almost drives O'Rourke Enterprises out of business when she opens a saloon across the street.

episodes.name: The 86 Proof Spring
episodes.overview: Parmenter searches for the Hekawis' whiskey supply, unaware that it is hidden at Fort Courage.

episodes.name: Here Comes the Tribe
episodes.overview: The Chief's daughter is kidnapped by a brave from another tribe looking for a wife, and the troop comes to the rescue.

episodes.name: Iron Horse Go Home
episodes.overview: The Hekawis sell their land to the railroad and move into Fort Courage.

episodes.name: Our Hero, What's His Name?
episodes.overview: Agarn boasts to a girl he's trying to impress that he killed Geronimo, so Geronimo comes after Agarn.

episodes.name: Wrongo Starr and the Lady in Black
episodes.overview: A famous jinx comes to town and meets a widow whose four husbands have all died mysteriously.

episodes.name: El Diablo
episodes.overview: Agarn's look-a-like Mexican bandit cousin comes to town, and the Corporal must capture him to clear his name.

episodes.name: Go For Broke
episodes.overview: Jane's cousin, an inventor, helps Parmenter win a poker game to replace the pension funds lost by O'Rourke.

episodes.name: The New I.G.
episodes.overview: The new Inspector General plots to wipe out the Hekawis with a rifle he has invented.

episodes.name: Spy, Counterspy, Counter Counterspy
episodes.overview: Agarn is chosen to test a bullet proof vest, but it is stolen when Fort Courage in infiltrated by spies.

episodes.name: The Courtship of Wrangler Jane
episodes.overview: O'Rourke, figuring his operations will be more profitable with Wilton away, plays cupid for Wilton and Jane.

episodes.name: Play, Gypsy, Play
episodes.overview: Gypsies come and invade Fort Courage.

episodes.name: Reunion for O'Rourke
episodes.overview: Agarn arranges a celebration of O'Rourke's 25 years of service in the Army.

episodes.name: Captain Parmenter, One Man Army
episodes.overview: The men learn that they are not legally enlisted so they leave and Wilton is forced to man the fort alone.

episodes.name: Don't Ever Speak to Me Again
episodes.overview: Just before the troop is to be cited for high morale, a fight breaks out.

episodes.name: Too Many Cooks Spoil the Troop
episodes.overview: O'Rourke adds things to the cook's food list in order to pad his pockets.

episodes.name: Indian Fever
episodes.overview: Agarn thinks he is crazy when he is the only one to see an Indian.

episodes.name: Johnny Eagle Eye
episodes.overview: O'Rourke expects to make money on a young Indian scout in the cavalry sharpshooting contest.

episodes.name: A Fort's Best Friend is Not a Mother
episodes.overview: Wilton's mother comes to visit and tries to tell him how to run the fort.

episodes.name: Lieutenant O'Rourke, Front and Center
episodes.overview: O'Rourke enterprises is in trouble when O'Rourke gets promoted to officer.

episodes.name: The Day the Indians Won
episodes.overview: The peaceable Hekawis are ordered to go on the warpath by the Council of Indian Nations.

episodes.name: Will the Real Captain Try to Stand Up?
episodes.overview: The town drunk poses as Captain to impress his visiting daughter.

episodes.name: The Singing Mountie
episodes.overview: A mountie is after the burglar of Banff, whom he believes is Agarn's look-a-like French Canadian cousin, Lucky Pierre Agarniere.

episodes.name: How to be F Troop Without Really Trying
episodes.overview: Everyone except Agarn is transferred, and he must train G Troop whose recruits turn out to be worse than F Troop.

episodes.name: Bye, Bye, Balloon
episodes.overview: A Prussian balloonist comes to the Fort to inspect prospective personnel.

episodes.name: Reach for the Sky, Pardner
episodes.overview: The bank wants to repossess the saloon when O'Rourke's payroll is stolen, so Agarn and O'Rourke volunteer to guard the next one.

episodes.name: The Great Troop Robbery
episodes.overview: A phony medicine man tries to blame his thefts on Agarn when Agarn suffers a temporary memory loss.

episodes.name: The West Goes Ghost
episodes.overview: O'Rourke Enterprises takes over a haunted ghost town, expecting to get rich when the railroad comes through.

episodes.name: Yellow Bird
episodes.overview: The daughter of a mining tycoon, kidnapped and raised by Indians, takes a liking to Wilton.

episodes.name: The Ballot of Corporal Agarn
episodes.overview: Agarn is to cast the deciding absentee vote in a hometown election.

episodes.name: Did Your Father Come from Ireland?
episodes.overview: O'Rourke's visiting father turns the town into Little Ireland while the Sergeant is on vacation.

episodes.name: For Whom the Bugle Tolls
episodes.overview: O'Rourke needs to distract a visiting colonel who enjoys bugle calls, but the trouble is that Dobbs is the army's worst bugler.

episodes.name: Miss Parmenter
episodes.overview: Wilton's husband-hunting sister goes after Dobbs, and also assists in Wild Eagle's appendectomy.

episodes.name: La Dolce Courage
episodes.overview: An Italian suitor challenges Agarn when Agarn goes after his beloved.

episodes.name: Wilton the Kid
episodes.overview: Capt. Parmenter's evil twin Kid Vicious has been robbing banks.

episodes.name: The Return of Wrongo Starr
episodes.overview: Wrongo gets mixed up with a goat and some dynamite when Parmenter assigns him as a guard.

episodes.name: Survival of the Fittest
episodes.overview: Parmenter and Agarn go on a wilderness survival test with only a knife, a canteen, and the new Army survival manual.

episodes.name: Bring on the Dancing Girls
episodes.overview: O'Rourke tries to get even with a blackmailer who took over the saloon.

episodes.name: The Loco Brothers
episodes.overview: Two renegade Indians trap Parmenter and hold him hostage, but just want some company.

episodes.name: From Karate with Love
episodes.overview: A samurai is looking for a Japanese girl.

episodes.name: The Sergeant and the Kid
episodes.overview: O'Rourke must talk a runaway 10-year-old boy out of joining the cavalry.

episodes.name: What Are You Doing after the Massacre?
episodes.overview: A 147-year-old Indian comes back to take over all of America, and begins by trying to starve the troop into surrender.

episodes.name: A Horse of Another Color
episodes.overview: Wilton wants to capture a wild stallion to impress Wrangler Jane, but O'Rourke wants to sell it to the circus..

episodes.name: V is for Vampire
episodes.overview: A Transylvanian Count that everyone thinks is a vampire is believed responsible for the disappearance of Wrangler Jane.

episodes.name: That's Show Biz
episodes.overview: Agarn leaves to manage a rock group called the Bedbugs, which is somewhat ahead of its time.

episodes.name: The Day They Shot Agarn
episodes.overview: Agarn faces a firing squad after everyone believes he killed Sgt. O'Rourke.

episodes.name: Only One Russian is Coming! Only One Russian is Coming!
episodes.overview: Agarn's look-a-like Russian Cossack cousin, Dmitri Agarnoff, comes to town and falls for Wrangler Jane, making Wilton jealous.

episodes.name: Guns, Guns, Who's Got the Guns?
episodes.overview: Parmenter goes undercover to find out who is selling guns to the Apaches after a colonel lets him know that someone in F Troop is a traitor.

episodes.name: Marriage, Fort Courage Style
episodes.overview: Their dreams of what could happen make Agarn and O'Rourke anxious to rescue Parmenter from a marriage broker.

episodes.name: Carpetbagging, Anyone?
episodes.overview: F Troop faces eviction when a rich carpetbagger comes to town, so they stage an Indian raid to prove they're still needed.

episodes.name: The Majority of Wilton
episodes.overview: When Parmenter catches a cold the day before his examination for promotion to major, his friends rush to his bedside with their homespun remedies.

episodes.name: Our Brave in F Troop
episodes.overview: Wild Eagle has a toothache, so O'Rourke sneaks him into the Fort to see a visiting dentist, where he has to pretend to be a member of the troop when he attracts the attention of a visiting general.

episodes.name: Is This Fort Really Necessary?
episodes.overview: An efficiency expert comes to Fort Courage, with the authority to close it down.
